item.title: Race conditions in database transactions
item.description: This post outlines different kinds of race conditions that may occur when database transactions are executed concurrently. Race Conditions Dirty Reads Dirty Writes Read Skew Lost updates Write Skew 1. Dirty Reads Dirty Reads occur when a transaction T1 reads another transaction T2’s result before T2 has committed its transaction. Dirty reads are problematic since uncommitted writes can always be reversed or changed again.
